wikipedia_page.main: General Sir Archibald Alison, 2nd Baronet  (21 January 1826 – 5 February 1907) was a Scottish soldier who achieved high office in the British Army in the 1880s. He was a descendant of the Alison family presented by Francis Galton in Hereditary Genius (1869) as an example of genius inherited over several generations.

response: *Sir Archibald Alison, 2nd Baronet (1826–1907), British Army general (son of the lawyer)
*Sir Archibald Alison, 2nd Baronet, British Army officer

response: * 21 January – Sir Archibald Alison, 2nd Baronet, British Army officer (died 1907 in London)
He was succeeded in the baronetcy by his elder son, Sir Archibald Alison, 2nd Baronet.
